result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis Andrew Rehberg

records.addlTxt: Defendant called JA Parks to inform the court that he does qualify for the SPD. 10.14.22. PP
Preliminary hearing on November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:00 AM Defendant Travis Andrew Rehberg appeared by video.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant requests a court appointed attorney. Court questions defendant about income, instructs defendant to contact SPD about counsel, contact JA Parks whether qualifies or not.  Court will appoint counsel if doesn't qualify. Court directs defendant to appear in person at next court date. Bond remains in effect.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Travis Reherg had left voice mail messages with the court as well as called the court early on 10.14.22.  He is unable to be in person and requests ZOOM appearance. DTE approved. Gave DEF ZOOM instructions over the phone. PP
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:15 AM  Defendant Travis Andrew Rehberg in court.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  State advises offer was made to defendant, not sure if he's accepting that offer or not.  Defendant indicates he's not accepting the offer, wishes to continue representing himself.  Court questions defendant whether he's requesting a preliminary hearing or not.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing be set.  Defendant requests his bond be modified.  State expresses their concern with bond being modified.  Court not changing bond today, remains as previously set.  Court sets prelim. on the record with JA Parks.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 11:15 am.

1:30 PM  Defendant Travis Andrew Rehberg appeared by video.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA. Court not addressing defendant's motion today, will wait until after he talks to DA Nordin for hearing motion.  Defendant needs to be in court in person to address motion.  Court does grant zoom appearance for next hearing if it's just a status.   Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:15 am.

from defendant indicating he would like to proceed pro se.    Will address on 7/14/22. DTE  (per Judge Ehlers, mail waiver of right to atty form to defendant to fill out and bring with him to court on 7/14/22 if he wishes to proceed pro se.  Form mailed to def. on todays date.  LS)
Subpoena Witness Data Sheet
Adjourned initial appearance on July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:18 PM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Travis Andrew Rehberg appeared by video.   Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on where he's at in retaining an attorney.  Defendant indicates he's talking to some attorney's, also requesting a bond modification due to religious reasons.  Court advises defendant to get counsel in place and that attorney can renew defendant's motion to modify his bond.  Court reschedules matter with hopes defendant will have counsel in place by next hearing.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant fingerprinted on 4/19/22.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

10:28 AM  Defendant Travis Andrew Rehberg in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defendant requests time to retain an attorney.  Defendant requests bond modification.  State not prepared to address bond modification today.  Court not prepared to deal with bond modification today, will take up at next hearing.  Court approves zoom for defendant for next hearing.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
from defendant requesting bond modification.
by Earlene Castelon
Uniform traffic citations

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

1:00 pm  Defendant Travis Andrew Rehberg appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  SPD indicated by email that defendant does not qualify for SPD representation. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 4/25/22 at 10:00 am.
